name: Lemon Spice Cake
description: This sweet and spicy Lemon Spice Cake requires no egg and very little fat! Use vegetable oil or shortening to make it vegan.
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp vegetable shortening, oil, or butter ($0.09)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, salt, cloves and lemon zest. Stir until everything is well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the flour, granulated sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, salt, cloves and lemon zest. Stir until everything is well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Make two wells in the dry ingredients and place the cider vinegar in one and shortening,oil or butter in the other (melt the shortening or butter first). Pour the water over everything and stir just until everything is wet. There may still be lumps but that is okay, just make sure there are no large pockets of dry stuff on the bottom.
recipeInstructions.name: Make two wells in the dry ingredients and place the cider vinegar in one and shortening,oil or butter in the other (melt the shortening or butter first). Pour the water over everything and stir just until everything is wet. There may still be lumps but that is okay, just make sure there are no large pockets of dry stuff on the bottom.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the batter into a loaf pan or 8×8 baking dish that has been sprayed with non-stick spray. Cook for 30-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. The batter will be more shallow in a square baking dish and will therefore cook faster than in a loaf pan. Keep an eye on the top, if it starts to crack, it is probably done. Let cool on a wire rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the batter into a loaf pan or 8×8 baking dish that has been sprayed with non-stick spray. Cook for 30-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. The batter will be more shallow in a square baking dish and will therefore cook faster than in a loaf pan. Keep an eye on the top, if it starts to crack, it is probably done. Let cool on a wire rack.

recipeInstructions.text: While the cake is cooling, make the lemon glaze. Place the powdered sugar in a small bowl and stir in the juice from the lemon. Depending on how much juice is in your lemon, you may not need all of it. Wait until the cake has cooled before pouring on the glaze or else the heat will cause the glaze to slide right off.
recipeInstructions.name: While the cake is cooling, make the lemon glaze. Place the powdered sugar in a small bowl and stir in the juice from the lemon. Depending on how much juice is in your lemon, you may not need all of it. Wait until the cake has cooled before pouring on the glaze or else the heat will cause the glaze to slide right off.

review.reviewBody: It's tasty. Still can taste the baking soda...I think I'm going to try this 3/4 c sugar. I find with vegan cake recipes that too much sugar melts but doesn't integrate properly with the other ingredients and then hardens at bottom. Could this be a function of my oven? Not sure but other cake recipes turn out ok... But tasty!
Does anyone know how to mess around and put mace into this ?

Delicious! I love how spicy the cake is! I made with gluten-free flour, and it turned out amazing. I even sifted the flour.

I just made the mistake of only cooking for 30 minutes in a loaf pan. It was kind of uncooked in the middle. I’m now realizing I should have done closer to 40 mins.
I'm a lemon cake lover so I was excited to try this recipe. I was really disappointed when I tasted a slice of my cake. It's too spicy so the taste of lemon is kind of absent
I used 1/2 tsp cardamom rather than cloves

I was intrigued by the recipe. Picture a 9x5 loaf pan.  I use my 8slot pan, aprox same volume for baking purposes. The whole recipe had only 1 Tablespoons of butter. No eggs. Did call for 1tsp apple cider vinegar.  I reduced the sugar 3/4 cup and think its sweet enough.

I added chopped almonds and hazel nuts, 30 grams.  I also added dried cherries 45 grams. Generally I mix the dried fruit in some of the flour to coat them and keep them from sinking. 

Recipe called it lemon spice cake. Has lemon zest. I think the cardamom, ginger, cinnamon and nutmeg cover up the lemon.

Rather than the glaze I used a streusal of 4T flour, 2T sugar, 1T butter. 

Enjoy.

Made this following the recipe exactly (with a loaf pan at 40 min) and my friend loved it. I would only mix 1 Tbsp lemon juice with the powdered sugar, 2 tbsp made my glaze too thin and it didn’t look like Beth’s photos.
Big yuck for me. Very dry and taste of cloves with lemon did not marry well. Had to throw out...just not eatable :-(

Everything worked out except for the size of the loaf pan.  I use an 8" when I should have used 9".  With the smaller pan, I had to bake it 55 min. and the top did crack.  Nevertheless, the lemon icing covered it up.   Only had to use 1 Tbsp. of (Meyer) lemon juice.  Same for the zest.  The extra baking time didn't affect the moistness--just made the edges a little crisper.

I made this recipe minus the lemon and spices plus 2 tsp of almond extract and 1/2 cup (soaked) dried cherries.  I have to bake it for 45 minutes for it to turn out right.  It's sooooooooo good!  I also made one minus spices plus orange extract (they never have lemon extract at my store) and 1/2 cup chocolate chips. Mmmmmmmmmmmm :) (I left the glaze off of both.)

Mmmm, I just made this and it's so good! I'm vegan and don't eat oil, so I replaced the butter with a tablespoon of applesauce. I also used the lemon extract instead of zest, lemon juice instead of ACV, and 1/2 tsp baking soda + 2 tsp baking powder instead of the full teaspoon. I used a silicone pan, didn't grease it (no oil, again), and didn't let it cool before taking it out of the pan (too impatient) so it stuck a little coming out and isn't super gorgeous, but my entire family has been scavenging about the pan because oh my gosh, it's delicious. We can't keep our mitts off it! I didn't even bother with the glaze, it's perfect without it. I can't believe how delicate the texture is, and how moist it turned out. I'll definitely be making this again. (:

This came up on my Facebook feed a couple of days ago, I've only just realised how old the post is.

Anyway.....

I ran my 200th parkrun this morning, something that NEEDS to be celebrated in the pub after with cake. I made this! I looked in the oven at just over 30 minutes baking, it sort of looked done but I thought it could do with another couple of minutes, oops, I made the mistake of sitting down with the iPad. 20 minutes later I remembered the cake. Anyhow, I glazed it and took it to the pub this morning. Still fabulously moist inside, tasted fantastic, got rave reviews! 
I didn't have any ground cloves so bashed 4 whole cloves to smithereens, I was worried that it would be a bit overpowering, but no, it was lovely.

Thank you!

I'm trying to expand my baking to include treats suitable for eggless and/or vegan diets, and this cake was a resounding success! It baked evenly, rose nicely and relatively uniformly, has good, spicy flavour (though not particularly lemon-y without the glaze), and has a good texture. I don't think I'd guess it was eggless or only had 1 tablespoon oil if someone baked this for me; the texture was lighter than I anticipated!

The more nitpicky stuff for the recipe tinkers:
- I used 1/2 cup whole wheat flour and 1 cup AP; I halved the sugar (1/2 cup sugar total)
- I reduced the ground ginger to 1/2 tsp, added 1/4 tsp ground cardamon, and used 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice in place of ground nutmeg
- I used 1 tablespoon lemon juice from my lemon instead of vinegar; I also added 1 tsp vanilla to that well
- I baked in a convection oven at ~325F for 25 minutes in a 8x8 glass pan

Thank you to Diana for the recipe, and thank you, Beth, for getting permission to make this post and share this!
